parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
Stronger, more excellent. Comparative of a derivative of kratos; stronger, i.e. better, i.e. Nobler.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To inherit, obtain (possess) by inheritance, acquire. From kleronomos; to be an heir to.
Differing, different; hence: excellent. From diaphero; varying; also surpassing.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
